page.title: 15A TYPICAL WARDOUR VALE FARM
page.content: The farmer is{Mr Flower}who has farmed all his life.{Farming}has been in the Flower family for{60 years. Mr Flower grows{grass, wheat}and {fodderbeet.}He sends the{wheat}to the market for{animal}feed. He feeds the {fodderbeet}to the{cows}but does not feed it to them straight out of the field or they will get a{disease called{bloat.}When the{grass}is grown it is made into{silage}and it is then fed to the animals. The farm is{240 acres}and has about{15 {fields}on it. He has{145 cows}which are all{milkers, 18 heifers}which are all in calf, 11 young{heifers}and one {bull.}The bull calves are sent to market for meat. He also has five {ponies, 400 chickens, six pigs, four {dogs, 174 cows}and{80 ewes}making a total of{670 animals. {Charlotte, Christabel and Rebecca
